2.subquestion: Let $P$ be the point where rope $HP$ intersects the line connecting $C$ and $D$. Find the coordinates of $P$.

subanswer.text: Let $m=-7$ be the slope of the line connecting $C$ and $D$. Using the point-slope form of a line, $P$'s coordinates satisfy the equations \(y_p-y_c=m(x_p-x_c)\) and \(x_p-x_c=\dfrac{HD}{2}\). Here, $x_c=-1$, $y_c=-1$, and \(HD=\sqrt{(1.5-(-1))^2+(-\frac{11}{2}-\frac{1}{2})^2}=\sqrt{41.25}\approx 6.4\). Therefore, \(x_p=-1+\dfrac{6.4}{2}=\boxed{-2.2}\), and \(y_p=-1-(-7)(-2.2)=\boxed{12.4}\).
